doc.headline: Iranian terrorist blows off own leg after grenade rebounds in Bangkok
doc.post:
An Iranian terrorist carrying grenades blew off one of his legs and wounded four other people in a series of blasts in Bangkok.
The attacker was injured after lobbing a grenade at police which bounced back to him, said security forces.
He was staying with two other Iranians in a rented house in the Thai capital where police said they found more explosives. Possible targets were not immediately known.
Israel claimed the blasts were orchestrated by Iran. They came a day after Israeli diplomats were targeted in India and Georgia. Tehran denied the allegations.
Photographs showed the wounded man, named as Saeid Moradi, covered in dark soot on a pavement strewn with broken glass. He lay in front of a school with his head raised as if he was attempting to sit up or look around.
Hospital officials said Moradi’s right leg was severed below the knee. His left leg was intact but severely wounded.
The explosives were apparently detonated by accident, blowing off part of the roof of the house the men were living in. A second Iranian was arrested at Bangkok airport and a third is on the run, said police.
Israeli defence minister Ehud Barak claimed the Bangkok violence ‘proves once again that Iran and its proxies continue to perpetrate terror’. A ministerial colleague said: ‘We know who carried out the terror attacks and Israel will settle the score with them.’
However, Thai government sources said ‘more analysis’ was needed to determine who was behind the attack and whether Iran was involved.
